intro: Hunteria, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and are characterized by their striking, often showy flowers. Hunteria species typically have smooth, woody stems and produce small, clustered leaves. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive, often fragrant scent. They are adapted to arid environments and can thrive in well-drained soils.
